intro: Bulbostylis schoenoides, commonly known as the narrow-leaf sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wet or marshy environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant has slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. Its rhizomatous growth habit allows it to spread and form dense colonies in suitable habitats. The botanical features of Bulbostylis schoenoides make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
